content:
"""
The error indicates that the Stone Furnace has no Iron Ore or Coal, and I attempted to harvest Iron Ore from a resource patch that is not within reach. 
To resolve this, I need to ensure that I move to the resource patches for both Iron Ore and Coal before attempting to harvest them. 
I will adjust my approach to gather the necessary resources effectively.
"""

# First, I will move to the nearest Iron Ore patch and harvest Iron Ore.
iron_ore_position = nearest(Resource.IronOre)
move_to(iron_ore_position)  # Move to the Iron Ore position
harvest_resource(iron_ore_position, quantity=10)  # Harvest 10 Iron Ore

# Now, I will insert the harvested Iron Ore into the Stone Furnace.
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace_entity, quantity=10)

# Next, I will move to the nearest Coal patch and harvest Coal.
coal_position = nearest(Resource.Coal)
move_to(coal_position)  # Move to the Coal position
harvest_resource(coal_position, quantity=10)  # Harvest 10 Coal

# Now, I will insert the harvested Coal into the Stone Furnace.
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace_entity, quantity=10)

# After ensuring that both Iron Ore and Coal are present, I will wait for the furnace to produce Iron Plates.
# Wait for a maximum of 30 seconds for more Iron Plates to be produced
for _ in range(30):  
    current_iron_plates = inspect_inventory(furnace_entity)[Prototype.IronPlate]
    if current_iron_plates >= 3:  # At least 3 Iron Plates needed
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Furnace timeout - check fuel and inputs for iron plates.")

# Now I can collect Iron Plates from the Stone Furnace
if current_iron_plates >= 3:
    extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, furnace_entity.position, quantity=3)
else:
    raise Exception("Not enough Iron Plates available to extract.")

# Proceed to craft 2 Iron Gear Wheels
for _ in range(2):  # I need 2 Iron Gear Wheels
    craft_item(Prototype.IronGearWheel)

# Verify if the crafting of Iron Gear Wheels was successful
assert inspect_inventory()[Prototype.IronGearWheel] >= 2, "Failed to craft 2 Iron Gear Wheels."

# Now I will craft the Burner Mining Drill
drill_quantity = craft_item(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill)

# Verify if the crafting was successful
assert drill_quantity == 1, f"Expected to craft 1 Burner Mining Drill, but crafted {drill_quantity}"

# Place the Burner Mining Drill next to the furnace.
drill_entity = place_entity_next_to(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill, furnace_entity.position, Direction.RIGHT)

# Verify if the drill was placed successfully
assert drill_entity, "Failed to place the Burner Mining Drill."

# Collect coal again for the drill after harvesting resources
harvest_resource(coal_position, quantity=10)  # Harvest some more coal
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, drill_entity, quantity=5)  # Insert coal into the drill

# Insert more iron ore into the furnace to keep it operational
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace_entity, quantity=10)  # Insert iron ore into the furnace

print("Setup is complete with a functional Burner Mining Drill and Stone Furnace!")
